answerText: Dream on Monkey Mountain[10] This poem by the author of Dream on Monkey Mountain tells of the fishermen Achille and Hector and their battle for the affections of Helen as well as the story of Plunkett and Maud who live on the same island.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 2 | 3 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this play, Tigre and Souris are judges for Makak's trial in which Makak repeats his story about a white woman in his dream. For 10 points each: [10] Name this play in which Corporal Lestrade arrests Makak on an unnamed island in the West Indies.
